    • Usage: 4 (Plant maintenance)58.
    • Status: 4 (Released)59.
    • Work center: Enter the responsible maintenance work center60.
  3. Operations Overview:
    • Click the Operations button.
    • Enter the individual steps (operations) for the task:
      • Op. 10: "Check seal for leaks"
      • Op. 20: "Measure vibration levels"
      • Op. 30: "Lubricate bearings"
    • For each operation, enter the
  • Work required (e.g., 1 hour)61.
  1. Save the task list. Now, this template can be pulled into any maintenance order for a pump inspection.

Part 2: The Comprehensive Integrated Test Plan

  • This section provides end-to-end scenarios to test the master data you've learned to create. Each exercise builds upon the concepts from the guide.

Test Scenario 1: Procure-to-Pay with a New Material and Supplier

  • Objective: Test the end-to-end P2P cycle using newly created master data.
  • Phase 1: Master Data Setup
    • Exercise 1.1: Using the Manage Business Partner Master Data app, create a new supplier named "Global Supplies Inc." Create the General, FI Vendor, and Supplier roles.
    • Exercise 1.2: Using transaction MM01, create a new Raw Material (ROH) named "Steel Plate". Create Basic Data, Purchasing, General Plant/Storage, and Accounting views. Ensure the Valuation Class is set for raw materials.
    • Exercise 1.3 (Optional but Recommended): Using the Manage Purchasing Info Records app, create an info record linking "Steel Plate" and "Global Supplies Inc.", defining a standard price and delivery time.
    • Exercise 1.4: Using the Manage Source Lists app, create a source list for "Steel Plate" in your plant, marking "Global Supplies Inc." as a fixed vendor.
  • Phase 2: Transactional Process (End-User Test)
    • Exercise 1.5: Using the Create Purchase Order - Advanced app, create a purchase order for 100 units of "Steel Plate" from "Global Supplies Inc."
    • Exercise 1.6: Using the Post Goods Receipt for Purchase Order app, receive the 100 units into stock.
    • Exercise 1.7: Using the Manage Stock app, verify that the stock of "Steel Plate" has increased by 100 units.
    • Exercise 1.8: Using the Create Supplier Invoice app, post the invoice received from "Global Supplies Inc." against your purchase order.
  • Expected Results:
    • The purchase order is created without errors.
    • A material document and an accounting document are generated upon goods receipt.
    • Stock levels are correct.
    • The invoice is posted successfully, creating a payable in the supplier's account.

Test Scenario 2: Order-to-Cash with a Batch-Managed Product (FEFO)

  • Objective: Test the O2C cycle, verifying that automatic batch determination proposes the batch with the earliest expiration date.
  • Phase 1: Master Data & Prerequisite Setup
    • Exercise 2.1: Create a new customer named "Retail Partners LLC" using the Manage Business Partner Master Data app.
    • Exercise 2.2: Create a new Finished Good (FERT) named "Organic Granola". Activate Batch Management in the Plant Data view. In the Classification view, assign the class YB_EXP_DATE_001 you created in the guide.
    • Exercise 2.3: Ensure your Batch Search Strategy (VCH1) and Sort Sequence (CU70) for FEFO are correctly set up for your "Organic Granola" material.
    • Exercise 2.4: Using the Manage Sales Prices app, create a price condition for "Organic Granola".
    • Exercise 2.5 (Crucial Prerequisite): You must have stock of this material. Post two different batches into stock using the Post Goods Movement (MIGO) app with movement type 561 (Initial stock entry).
      • Batch 1: GRANOLA-01, Quantity: 50, Expiration Date: 6 months from today.
      • Batch 2: GRANOLA-02, Quantity: 50, Expiration Date: 3 months from today.
  • Phase 2: Transactional Process (End-User Test)
    • Exercise 2.6: Using the Create Sales Orders app, create an order for "Retail Partners LLC" for 20 units of "Organic Granola".
    • Exercise 2.7: Using the Create Outbound Deliveries from Sales Orders app, create a delivery for your sales order.
    • Exercise 2.8: Go into the outbound delivery document. Click the Batch Split button or navigate to the picking tab.
    • Verification: The system should have automatically proposed 20 units from batch GRANOLA-02, because it has the earlier expiration date.
    • Exercise 2.9: Post Goods Issue for the delivery.
    • Exercise 2.10: Using the Create Billing Documents app, create the invoice for the customer.
  • Expected Results:
    • The FEFO strategy correctly identifies and proposes the batch with the nearest expiration date.
    • Stock of batch GRANOLA-02 is reduced by 20.
    • All corresponding financial and material documents are created correctly.

Test Scenario 3: Plant Maintenance with Warranties

  • Objective: Test the linkage of maintenance master data to a transactional process.
  • Phase 1: Master Data Setup
    • Exercise 3.1: Using the Create Equipment app, create a piece of equipment, e.g., "Centrifugal Pump P-101".
    • Exercise 3.2: Using BGM1, create a "24-Month Premium Warranty".
    • Exercise 3.3: In the Change Equipment app, go to the Warranties tab and assign your new warranty to the pump, setting the warranty start date.
    • Exercise 3.4: Using the Manage Task Lists app, create a task list for "Pump Seal Replacement" with at least two operations.
  • Phase 2: Transactional Process (End-User Test)
    • Exercise 3.5: A technician reports that pump P-101 is leaking. Using the Create Maintenance Notification app, create a new notification for equipment P-101.
    • Exercise 3.6: From the notification, create a Maintenance Order. On the order, check that the system displays a warning or information message that the equipment is under warranty.
    • Exercise 3.7: In the Maintenance Order, use the menu function Extras -> Task list selection to find and copy the operations from your "Pump Seal Replacement" task list into the order.
  • Expected Results:
    • The warranty information is visible and active on the equipment and is flagged during the maintenance order creation.
    • The operations from the task list are successfully copied into the order, saving manual entry and standardizing the repair process.

entry.title: Re: Delivery error- wrong recipient address
entry.content:
Hello @JackN11 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Edition, after Output Management sends a purchase order form, the system only records whether the email was successfully sent to the mail server. This means Monitor Email Transmissions may display “Succeeded” even if the recipient’s mailbox no longer exists, as SAP does not get delivery

3265907 - Output Items of Email channel are completed but emails does not reach recipient - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

3274509 - Emails do not reach the recipients - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Best practices:

Maintain supplier contact data in the BP master
Regularly review and update contact details, and use generic distribution addresses, such as purchasing@vendor.com. SAP Help – Business Partner Maintenance

Configure and monitor the reply-to address
Set up a monitored sender or reply-to address in Output Management to ensure bounce-back emails from invalid supplier addresses are captured.SAP Help – Output Management in S/4HANA Cloud

Use alternative transmission channels for critical POs
Where reliability is essential, consider Ariba Network, EDI, or supplier portals as the primary channels, with email as a backup. SAP Help – Integration with SAP Business Network

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: I_BillingDocumentTextTP : field LongText is empty
entry.content:
Hello @hans_segers 

The CDS view I_BillingDocumentTextTP only provides the keys BillingDocument, Language, LongTextID. The LongText field consistently appears blank because the actual long-text content is not exposed through that CDS.

The recommended way to read invoice header texts in Public Cloud is via the released Billing Document API.

  • Service: API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV
  • Entity: A_BillingDocumentText → contains the LongText field

Example OData call:

/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/A_BillingDocumentText

  ? $filter=BillingDocument eq '0090000122'

           and Language eq 'E'

           and LongTextID eq 'TX06'

This will return the header text content TEXT EXAMPLE FOR XML in your screenshot.

In Public Cloud, you cannot access STXH/STXL or use READ_TEXT. Use the Billing Document API instead.

Refer to the helpful SAP Documentation below.

Business Accelerator Hub- Billing Document - Read, Cancel, GetPDF

SAP Help-Billing Document

KBA 3282990 - CDS View for Sales Order Long Text not available in S/4HANA Cloud

Let me kow if it was you needed

With best regrads

Chum

entry.title: Re: MT940 format for credit card statement
entry.content:
Hello @S0027169027 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Configuring Bank Statement Processing & How to Import Payment Files. They provide insightful details for your question.

To summarise, you can us MT940, BA12 and camt.053 formats for bank and credit statement uploads in public cloud.

  • For Malaysia, if your credit card issuer can deliver the statement in MT940 or camt.053, then you can upload it directly through the manage incoming bank statements app.
  • If the bank only provides the statement in Excel, you will need to convert it into MT940 or camt.053 format. You will need a middleware an example is SAP integration Suite or a bank-provided converter.

There is no separate format for credit card statements. They are treated as part of the electronic bank statement process.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Electronic Customer Invoice HU: wrong originalInvoice...
entry.content:
Hi @SebastianB 

Thank you for your question.

Based on the description you provided, what you experienced is expected in Hungary NAV mapping. The originalinvoicenumber point back by default to the invoice reference. This means that when a credit memo is cancelled, the payload shows the original invoice rather than the credit memo. The Define eDocument mapping app will enable you meet your requirement.

Follow the descriptions Adjusting or Enhancing Mapping of Sample Implementation, Configure the eDocument Cockpit & Online Invoicing for Hungary for implementation steps.

  • First is to copy the delivered version and create your custom mapping version
  • Then locate the originalinvoicenumber field in the invoice reference code.
  • Thereafter, you need to add a conditional rule so that if the document is a cancellation of credit memo, the system will use the credit memo number instead.
  • Finally, activate and assign this mapping version for Hungary NAV and rebuild the eDocument in the cockpit.

After the changes, invoice cancellations will still reference the original invoice but credit memo cancellations will correctly reference the cancelled credit memo.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Display of Opening Movement from balance carryforward...
entry.content:
Hello @BlasRosello4 

Thank you for your question.

Have look at Balance Carryforward &  Document and Reporting Compliance

To summarise, the balance carryforward process does not generate an FI document in public cloud. Instead, it posts balances into Period 0 of ACDOCA. This results in DRC object AR_JOURNAL_LEDGER not displaying these opening movements in the Libro Diario because it is based on document.

Presently, there is no standard way to have it show the opening balance carryforward. However, you can approach it by:

  • Providing the Balance Carryforward Report alongside the legal Journal as a supporting document.
  • Alternatively, you can build a custom CDS View that includes Period 0 balances and integrate it into a custom reporting object in DRC if your custom requires the Libro Diario to display opening balances directly.

This approach does not only keep you legally compliant, but it also keeps you within the public cloud extensibility framework.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori Apps
entry.content:
Hi @JackN11 

Thank you for your question.

Have look at Export Master Data - Business Partners (New), Export Master Data - BP Relationships (New), Import Master Data - Business Partners (New) & Business Partner (A2X) – OData API for details to guide you.

To summarise, based on your description, it does not seem to be a bug but a limitation of the Export/Import Master Data and Business Partner apps. It is important to note that, the export creates an XML file with a strict schema, if you open and modify it in Excel, the schema integrity might be broken. On importing the document you modified, the system cannot parse the file correctly which is why it gets stuck and flickers.

  • It is recommended to use these apps only for moving business partner data between tenant without altering the file.
  • For mass changes or transformations, make sure you use the Migration Cockpit or the Business Partner OData API.
  • If you need to enrich business partners, adjust them after you have imported the file. Make sure to use Manage business partner master data app.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Budget Availability Control
entry.content:
Hello @jantoniomoyano3 

Thank you for your question.

These Integration with Budget Availability Control & Budget Availability Control for Cost Centers links will provide you more details.

To summarise, in public cloud, availability control is in your case always performed at the cost center, which is the object level.

  • When you define an account group for example 606, etc. in the availability control profile, the system still monitors all actuals and commitments posted to the cost center. It does this regardless of it belonging to the account group.
  • That is why the posting you made to account 620 reduces your available budget in the commitments by cost center app.
  • IF the total postings to the cost center exceeds the budget, then the tolerance limit is triggered, not just the accounts in the group.

If you need a stricter control by G/L account class, you will need to configure separate profiles or hand this in reporting since availability control in public cloud is based on cost center.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Unable to Add EAN/ECP (MARA-EAN11) to Extended Data S...
entry.content:
Good day @ASG 

 

Thank you for your question.

These Data Source Extension  & Product Sales Delivery Core Entity links will provide you more details.

To summarise, what you are experiencing is a public cloud standard behaviour. Even though you added MARA-EAN11 through a data source extension, the filed is not populated in your output because MARA-EAN11 is not always filled in the material master. The output data source FDP_PP_MOR_DATA_LIST_SRV  is not directly joined to MARA in a way that provides this field.

  • Instead of MARA-EAN11, i recommend you use a released CDS view such as I_Product. This includes international Article Number.
  • Then extend your data source with this field from I_Product. If you need special handling, make use of a Logic BAdI to populate your custom field during runtime.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Ad...
entry.content:
Hi @FabianSCC 

When you use Exclusive Indicator = X in the email row, the system only checks that row. If you did not provide any email recipient, the process ends with an error and does not fall back to print.

  • Consider keeping the first-row wit Default Email Address = is not initial, Channel= EMAIL, Exclusive Indicator= - (empty).
  • Then add the second row with Default Email address = is initial, Channel = PRINT

This way, if an email is maintained, the dunning is sent by mail. If no email is maintained, the print rule is applied.

Only use the Exclusive Indicator if you want the system to stop evaluating further rules once it finds a match. This is not the case for your fallback logic.

Best regards

Chris
